<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Gear Up](/Feats.aspx?ID=3480) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 29</row>

**Archetype** [Undead Slayer](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=174)

**Prerequisites**
[Undead Slayer Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3474)

</column>

---

Whether it's wooden stakes, holy water, or more unusual tools, you always have just the right thing to handle an [undead's](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) unusual weaknesses and vulnerabilities. You gain the [Prescient Planner](/Feats.aspx?ID=2143) and [Prescient Consumable](/Feats.aspx?ID=2142) feats. When using Prescient Planner specifically to pull out an item you need to deal with an undead's weakness or vulnerability, you can pull out the item as a 2-action activity to remove your backpack (or similar container) and draw the item, rather than taking 1 minute. If you have the Hunter's Sanctum feat, you keep your sanctum well stocked with the basics and can spend 1 hour in your sanctum refreshing your supplies in order to meet the requirements for Prescient Planner, even if you haven't been able to purchase goods.
